channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024110822
item.description:
Report X-2024110822

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-14
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location a plastic Fedex envelope ripped open reveling the contents. Inside was a single spray bottle of Zep acidic cleaner. The spill agent looked up an SDS of the cleaner and it was a UN1789 class 8. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outer packaging. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report X-2024110650
item.description:
Report X-2024110650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-10
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment two one gallon plastic containers were inside of the fiberboard box and the cap was loose on one of them. The label of the plastic container stated the contents were flammable liquid and vapor so the spill agent looked for an SDS it states the product is UN1993. There were no DG markings on the out packaging or paperwork. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the loaction.

item.title: Report X-2024110699
item.description:
Report X-2024110699

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE GLOVES,GOGGLES,BOOTS,APRON,SILVER LINING WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACEDINTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTI ETT.
